definition: climax (in a story)
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to keep listeners in suspense (in storytelling)/to keep people on tenterhooks

sentences.english: Keeping the audience guessing is a common technique in storytelling, the term for it is Liukouzi.
sentences.chinese: 賣關子是評書中常用的手段技巧，術語稱留釦子。

sentences.english: Hey, tell us the ending of the story quickly. Don't keep us guessing.
sentences.chinese: 快告訴我們故事的結局吧，別賣關子了。
